oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sheet Music Booklet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: An original song booklet containing the lyrics to 37 labor songs, including "America the Beautiful" and "We Will Overcome."

The song "We Shall Overcome" began as the gospel song "We Will Overcome." It was first used as a protest song by striking cigar workers in Charleston, South Carolina, led by Lucille Simmons, in 1945. Zilphia Horton learned the song from Simmons, and taught it to organizers while musical director at Highlander Folk School. This is where Pete Seeger and Guy Carawan learned the tune and all three are credited on the copyright. The three continued teaching the song at Highlander after its switch to Civil Rights and here began the song's transition to a Civil Rights mainstay. Dr. Martin Luther King even quoted the song in his final speech at Mason Temple in Memphis, Tennessee, the night before his assassination.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Folk music; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Working class--Education; Working class--Songs and music; Labor movement; Labor movement--United States--History
